Race.SpecificTitle: PW School District -- Local Option - Term Limits
Race.FullText:
"LOCAL OPTION ELECTION
Within Richland Parish School District:
Shall the number of terms of office that any member of the school board may serve be limited to three consecutive four-year terms?"

Race.SpecificTitle: Start-Girard Fire Prot. Dist. -- $100 Parcel Fee - BOC - 25 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Start-Girard Fire Protection District Proposition
(Parcel Fee Renewal)

Summary:  25 years, $100.00 parcel fee renewal in Start-Girard Fire Protection District for the purpose of acquiring, constructing, maintaining and/or operating fire protection facilities and equipment, including paying the cost of obtaining water for fire protection purposes and salaries of firemen, and all purposes incidental thereto, with the proceeds of the parcel fee to be funded into bonds from time to time in the manner provided by law.
Race.FullText: Shall Start-Girard Fire Protection District, Richland Parish, Louisiana (the "District"), levy and collect an annual parcel fee of One Hundred Dollars ($100.00) on each lot, subdivided portion of ground or individual tract upon which is located, either in whole or in part, a residential or commercial structure, regardless of the structure's being occupied or unoccupied (an estimated $80,000 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the parcel fee for an entire year), for a period of twenty-five (25) years, beginning with the year 2014 and ending with the year 2038, for the purpose of acquiring, constructing, maintaining and/or operating fire protection facilities and equipment, including paying the cost of obtaining water for fire protection purposes and salaries of firemen, and all purposes incidental thereto, and shall the District be further authorized to fund the proceeds of said parcel fee into bonds issued from time to time in the manner provided by law, including, but not limited to, Act 402 of the 1988 Regular Session of the Louisiana Legislature?

Race.SpecificTitle: Archibald-Alto Fire Prot. Dist -- $100 Parcel Fee - BOC - 25 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Archibald-Alto Fire Protection District Proposition
(Parcel Fee Renewal)

Summary:  25 years, $100.00 annual parcel fee renewal in Archibald-Alto Fire Protection District for the purpose of acquiring, constructing, maintaining and operating fire protection facilities and equipment, including paying the cost of obtaining water for fire protection purposes and salaries of firemen, and all purposes incidental thereto, with the proceeds of the parcel fee to be funded into bonds from time to time in the manner provided by law.
Race.FullText: Shall Archibald-Alto Fire Protection District of the Parish of Richland, State of Louisiana (the "District"), levy and collect an annual parcel fee of One Hundred Dollars ($100.00) on each lot, subdivided portion of ground or individual tract upon which is located, either in whole or in part, a residential or commercial structure, regardless of the structure's being occupied or unoccupied (an estimated $100,400.00 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the parcel fee for an entire year), for a period of twenty-five (25) years beginning with the year 2014 and ending with the year 2038, for the purpose of acquiring, constructing, maintaining and operating fire protection facilities and equipment, including paying the cost of obtaining water for fire protection purposes and salaries of firemen, and all purposes incidental thereto, and shall the District be further authorized to fund the proceeds of said parcel fee into bonds to pay the costs of capital improvements, said bonds to be issued from time to time in the manner provided by law, including, but not limited to, Act 402 of the 1988 Regular Session of the Louisiana Legislature?

Race.SpecificTitle: Holly Ridge Fire Prot. Dist. -- $100 Parcel Fee - BOC - 25 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Holly Ridge Fire Protection District Proposition
(Parcel Fee Renewal)

Summary:  25 years, $100.00 annual parcel fee renewal in Holly Ridge Fire Protection District for the purpose of acquiring, constructing, maintaining and operating fire protection facilities and equipment, including paying the cost of obtaining water for fire protection purposes and salaries of firemen, and all purposes incidental thereto, with the proceeds of the parcel fee to be funded into bonds from time to time in the manner provided by law.
Race.FullText: Shall Holly Ridge Fire Protection District of the Parish of Richland, State of Louisiana (the "District"), levy and collect an annual parcel fee of One Hundred Dollars ($100.00) on each lot, subdivided portion of ground or individual tract upon which is located, either in whole or in part, a residential or commercial structure, regardless of the structure's being occupied or unoccupied (an estimated $74,300.00 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the parcel fee for an entire year), for a period of twenty-five (25) years beginning with the year 2014 and ending with the year 2038, for the purpose of acquiring, constructing, maintaining and operating fire protection facilities and equipment including paying the cost of obtaining water for fire protection purposes and salaries of firemen, and all purposes incidental thereto, and shall the District be further authorized to fund the proceeds of said parcel fee into bonds to pay the costs of capital improvements, said bonds to be issued from time to time in the manner provided by law, including, but not limited to, Act 402 of the 1988 Regular Session of the Louisiana Legislature?

Race.SpecificTitle: Ward One Rural Fire Dist. -- 6.55 Mills - BOC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Ward One Rural Fire District Proposition
(Tax Continuation)

Summary:  10 year 6.55 mills property tax continuation for the purpose of acquiring, constructing, maintaining, and operating fire protection facilities and equipment in and for the District, including paying the cost of obtaining water for fire protection purposes and salaries of firemen, and all purposes incidental thereto.
Race.FullText: Shall Ward One Rural Fire District of the Parish of Richland, State of Louisiana (the "District"), continue to levy and collect a special tax of six and fifty-five hundredths (6.55) mills on all property subject to taxation in said District (an estimated $450,315.69 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for a period of ten (10) years beginning with the year 2013 and ending with the year 2022, for the purpose of acquiring, constructing, maintaining, and operating fire protection facilities and equipment in and for the District, including paying the cost of obtaining water for fire protection purposes and salaries of firemen, and all purposes incidental thereto?
